Money Diaries: A 32-year-old accountant on €50k living in Clare with his wife and child Link: https://www.thejournal.ie/readme/finances-in-covid-19-5123952-Jun2020/

Tips on handling the Covid-19 isolation from a solo sailor Link: https://www.thejournal.ie/readme/sailing-and-covid-19-5091887-Jun2020/

Your say

Poll: Should geography matter when choosing ministers? Link: https://www.thejournal.ie/poll-ministers-geography-5138090-Jul2020/

THE GOVERNMENT IS expected use junior ministerial appointments to ease some of the criticism Link: https://www.thejournal.ie/cabinet-government-west-micheal-martin-ministers-jobs-5137999-Jul2020/ of the lack of geographical spread among senior ministers. 

It comes after no TDs from west of the River Shannon were appointed to lead a department Link: https://www.thejournal.ie/dara-calleary-5135818-Jun2020/ . The first time this has happened. 

While some people say it should not matter where ministers are from, as they all have a national remit, others argue it’s important in terms of representation. But what do you think?

Poll: Should geography matter when choosing ministers?

Poll Results:

No, it shouldn't matter (3792)

It's a factor but not the main one (2269)

Yes, it's important (2038)

Your view probably depends on where you're from yourself (485)

Don't know (58)

  • Yes, it's important
  • It's a factor but not the main one
  • No, it shouldn't matter
  • Your view probably depends on where you're from yourself
  • Don't know
